title: Zadoc Benedict
text:
Zadoc Benedict was a <a href="hat">hat</a> manufacturer who established the first hat factory on Main Street in <a href="Danbury%2C%20Connecticut">Danbury, Connecticut</a> in 1780. It had 3 employees, and made 18 hats weekly.
Legend holds that Benedict plugged a hole in his shoe with <a href="rabbit%20fur">rabbit fur</a>, and found that over time the <a href="fur">fur</a> turned into <a href="felt">felt</a>. He then supposedly developed a process of making hats from the fur of locally available animals, like rabbit and <a href="beaver">beaver</a>.
